rfp_meta.title: REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL
rfp_meta.purpose: Samsic UK is seeking bid management and writing software to enhance tendering processes, improve efficiency, and increase contract success rates.
rfp_meta.project_description: The project involves identifying a software system that can streamline bid content creation, integrate with existing systems, and support AI-driven content generation.

presentation_details.location: Samsic UK, Unit 2 Oak Court, Pilgrims Way, Prologis Park, Coventry, CV6 4QH
presentation_details.format: 45-minute presentation followed by a 15-minute Q&A session
topics_to_cover: Key features and highlights of the system
Relevant case studies and 2 client references

submission_requirements: Submit a bona fide Tender on or before the Tender return date
special_conditions: All costs incurred in the preparation of a bona fide Tender are for the Tendering Contractor's own account and irrecoverable from Samsic UK.
Data shared, processed, or accessed must comply with UK GDPR and the Data Protection Act 2018.
All information provided by Samsic UK in connection with this RFP shall be treated as strictly confidential.

extracted_requirements.business_impact: Ensures seamless operation with existing infrastructure.
extracted_requirements.source_section: As part of the system capabilities, we require

extracted_requirements.text: The ability to import our existing bid library
extracted_requirements.business_impact: Facilitates continuity and efficiency in bid preparation.
extracted_requirements.source_section: As part of the system capabilities, we require

extracted_requirements.text: AI-driven content generation and web-based access
extracted_requirements.business_impact: Enhances content creation efficiency and accessibility.
extracted_requirements.source_section: As part of the system capabilities, we require

extracted_requirements.text: 5 super user accounts (for Project Managers and Bid Managers)
extracted_requirements.business_impact: Allows key personnel to manage and oversee bid processes.
extracted_requirements.source_section: As part of the system capabilities, we require

extracted_requirements.text: 10 additional users with permissions to review content and create smaller proposals
extracted_requirements.business_impact: Enables broader team collaboration and proposal creation.
extracted_requirements.source_section: As part of the system capabilities, we require

extracted_requirements.business_impact: Demonstrates financial benefits and value proposition.

extracted_requirements.business_impact: Ensures timely and effective deployment of the solution.

extracted_requirements.business_impact: Ensures long-term usability and reliability of the system.

extracted_requirements.business_impact: Provides evidence of capability and past success.

company_profile.name: Samsic UK
company_profile.overview: Samsic UK is a facilities management provider offering a range of services including cleaning, security, and related hard and soft services. The company employs over 3000 personnel and operates from 12 regional offices, serving over 1700 sites on behalf of 750 organizations.
company_profile.size: Over 3000 employees, serving 1700 sites for 750 organizations
technology_stack: Samsic One app for client and employee communications
company_profile.market_position: Samsic UK is positioned as a leader in AI-powered office cleaning services and offers innovative solutions like the PEGO AI cleaning technology for demand-driven efficiency.
recent_projects: Digital security management platform trials at Pladis Global
partnerships: Adaptiv Systems for IoT solutions and digital transformation
company_profile.additional_info: Samsic UK has launched a property management app to enhance client and employee communications and processes. The company emphasizes a people-centric model to improve employee engagement and service delivery.

Oct 2, 2023—We are a leading provider of trusted facilities management services working across a range of sectors, including healthcare, corporate and education.

# Samsic UK launches integrated security operations and workforce management platform Samsic UK is launching an integrated security operations and workforce management platform after trials at Pladis Global. Its functionality ranges from paperless time and attendance reporting and payroll processing to affording clients a single view into security staffing, operations and compliance via its live dashboard. In late 2019, testing commenced of SamTech by the security and client management teams at Pladis to assess its day-to-day functionality and performance as well as the accuracy and quality of reporting capabilities. Says Samsic UK Security Director, Andrew Hallam: “Centralising management and reporting into a digitally-driven process brings cost and productivity benefits to provider and client.
